result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
VIP program for a period of 1 year.
Defendant subject to all conditions/rules of the DJA and VIP program.

judgments.dispoDesc:
Court accepts plea. No finding of guilt. Court accepts DJA.
Court suspends case for a period of 1 year and places defendant in VIP program.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heidi Marie Anderson

records.addlTxt: 10:28 AM Defendant Heidi Marie Anderson in court.  Edward Daniel Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court makes stmt. Victim rights. Court reviews RTAW, previously filed. Defendant makes stmt. Court finds defendant is freely and voluntarily waiving her right to counsel and is able to proceed with representing herself. Court reviews DJA w/ defendant and defendant understands agreement. Defendant waives reading of charge and enters a plea of NO CONTEST. PLQ received/reviewed by the Court w/ the defendant. Court finds the defendant's plea to be made freely and voluntarily and accepts the plea. Factual basis. Court withhold any finding of guilt or any judgment of conviction and approves the DJA and suspends the case for a period of one year. Defendant placed in the VIP program. Defendant subject to all conditions/rules of the DJA and VIP program.
Plea hearing on March 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Heidi Marie Anderson

Prior: 6312 CTH I, Lena, WI 54139

02:03 PM Defendant Heidi Marie Anderson in court.  Edward Daniel Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Would like to discuss resolution with DA.  DA will send offer to deft.  Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

w/condition   Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages.  Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall have no violent or abusive contact with alleged victim.    Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.

12:58PM Defendant Heidi Marie Anderson in court, in custody.  Edward Daniel Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heidi Marie Anderson appeared by video means.    Def given complaint, advised of charges, and advised of right to counsel/SPD.  Bond is set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
